before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"bclic","text":"Note: The amount of RNA required for detection depends on the abundance of the RNA of interest. In general, we recommend, using \u003e 10 copies of the (SARS-CoV-2) viral genome as input. In addition, we recommend setting up a no template control reaction and all reactions are set-up in a hood.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":255,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"41rgj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"flc6t","text":"The presence of carry-over products can interfere with sequencing accuracy, particularly for low copy targets. Therefore, it is important to carry out the appropriate no template control (NTC) reactions to demonstrate that positive reactions are meaningful.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d3ml","text":"This protocol details methods for the preparation of  SARS-CoV-2 sequencing library using VSS primers from library preparation from NEBNext® ARTIC SARS-CoV-2 Companion Kit (Oxford Nanopore Technologies®), NEB #E7660S/L 24/96 reactions adapted for wastewater samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7eat2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gvk1","text":"Standard Protocol with PCR Bead Cleanup: This protocol includes a cleanup and normalization step for each sample after cDNA synthesis. Performing the cleanup and normalization step creates library pools where the reads for each library are more evenly distributed. These pools will likely achieve sufficient and equal coverage in less run time, but they take more hands-on time","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2dv01","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8hfa","text":"This protocol also includes options for barcoding with dual indexing or single indexing of the samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: NEBNext® ARTIC SARS-CoV-2 Companion Kit (Oxford Nanopore Technologies®) E7660

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"b3618","text":"Overview ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5lll","text":"The NEBNext ARTIC SARS-CoV-2 Companion Library Prep Kit (Oxford Nanopore Technologies) contains the enzymes, buffers, beads and oligos required to convert a broad range of total RNA input amounts into targeted, high quality libraries for next-generation sequencing on the Oxford Nanopore platform. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43ejn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duvef","text":"Each kit component must pass rigorous quality control standards, and for each new lot the entire set of reagents is functionally validated together by construction and sequencing of an indexed library on the Oxford Nanopore sequencing platform. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2j265","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2cvp","text":"For larger volume requirements, customized and bulk packaging is available by purchasing through the OEM/Bulks department at NEB. Please contact OEM@neb.com for further information.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43q02","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dhbtr","text":"Figure 1. materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"98vit","text":"The Library Kit Includes NEB #E7660L/S and Oxford Nanopore Technologies Native Barcoding Expansion kits.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24},{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dbksk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fslhu","text":"This kit includes two sets of for primers:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66qpr","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdhep","text":"The VarSkip (for Variant Skip) Short primers have been designed at NEB to provide improved performance with SARS-CoV-2 variants, including the Omicron and Delta variants. The Omicron variant can be called confidently using NEBNext VarSkip Short (VSS) primers. Note that there are two dropouts (amplicons 56 and 67), and two amplicons (20 and 64) have lower coverage. Starting Feb 14th, 2022 NEB has V2 VSS primers in the kit, for improved Omicron coverage.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eh088","text":"The V3 ARTIC primers have been balanced, using methodology developed at NEB based on empirical data from sequencing. In combination with optimized reagents for RT-PCR, the kits deliver improved uniformity of amplicon yields from gRNA across a wide copy number range. {"blocks":[{"key":"4fhgq","text":"Use Qubit to quantify  . Follow Oxford Nanopore Protocol SQK-LSK109 to prepare MinION® flow cell and DNA library sequencing mix and load the flow cell. We highly recommend using a Negative template control and label them as 'water', 'negative', 'blank', 'ntc' if using our custom analysis pipeline for the data analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":85,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":151,"length":93}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7b73g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8l1tk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8sgn","text":"The base calling options can be one among the three: Fast base calling, High accuracy base calling, or Super accurate base calling. We have observed improved average read quality with High accuracy and Super accurate base calling, but little difference in read numbers, or variant calling compared to Fast base calling, using our custom analysis pipeline.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6avfn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dn2g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bgpq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","guid":"D97174906D7311EB95A4654104087860","id":"73084","label":"DNA sample","unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bu7d4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rfki","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ls4g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":272,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"aqa1k","text":"The presence of genomic DNA or carry-over products can interfere with sequencing accuracy, particularly for low copy targets. Therefore, it is important to carry out the appropriate no template control (NTC) reactions to demonstrate that positive reactions are meaningful.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bqp9v","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":71,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"clfoo","text":"Absolutely no vortexing of cDNA, amplicons, or libraries at any point.\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":229,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"9452g","text":"We have also verified cDNA synthesis using the Invitrogen™ SuperScript™ IV First-Strand Synthesis System (Catalog number:18091200), as described in the SNAP protocol with modifications (random hexamers, RT incubation of 30 min.).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ei14e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r509","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3eup3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":377,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"69gvg","text":"Since these are wastewater samples, low viral load samples are routinely expected. It is highly recommended that you set up 2-3 barcode reactions per sample. You will be setting up 2-3 sets following Step 30. Since, only 3ul - 5ul of End-prepped DNA (from step 28) is used per barcode ligation reaction, there is sufficient material to set up 3-5 barcode reactions per sample. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dsi9i","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c9u2q","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":173,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"58oo","text":"This is done to improve the volume of the total pooled barcoded sample, which will help in increasing the yield of cleaned barcoded DNA and ultimately more sequencing pores.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7u839","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gkre","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f11gp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":397,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"4n0iq","text":"Based on the qubit readings of the cleaned VSS amplicons(step 24), we recommend to adjust the concentration of the amplicons going into end prep and barcoding. In step 26, the amount recommended is 4ng/ul. In low titer wastewater samples, it is very hard to achieve this desired concentration. We do not recommend proceeding to end prep for VSS amplicons with a concentration less than 1.5 ng/ul. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9tjfo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ettnc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2e1m2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":313,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"tub6","text":"If the concentration of cDNA amplicons going to end prep is ~3-4 ng/ul, we recommend using 3ul of End-prepped DNA for barcoding (as mentioned in Step 30). If the concentration of cDNA amplicons is less than 3ng/ul (1.5ng/ul - 3ng/ul) going into end prep, we recommend using 5ul of End-prepped DNA into barcoding. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
